title: Links 11/14: I Link, Therefore I Am
summary:
Key ideas:
- An American chestnut tree that is blight-resistant has been genetically engineered and is being crowdfunded to replant thousands of specimens all over the US
- Doctor Strangelove was a movie based on true events regarding nuclear bombs and the Soviet auto-nuke doomsday device
- The Innocence Project recently framed an innocent person for a crime in order to get another person off death row
- Vox can predict a person's politics accurately based on their demographic information
- African conflicts are correlated with temperature and heat has been associated with crime in past research
- SpaceX is planning to provide cheap high-quality satellite internet to the entire world
- ISIS militants answer wannabe terrorists' questions via ask.fm
- The Supreme Court case that legalized interracial marriage in the US was called Loving vs. Virginia
- Person with heart attack taken to out-of-network hospital instead of a near-costless in-network hospital a few blocks away due to law
- Study confirms obvious that some people can stick to exercise but not lose weight

Key learnings:
- Traditional patriarchy can be awful
- Neighbourhood you grow up in may matter, but research on this is confounded by genetics
- High altitude may increase suicide rates through oxygen depletion
- Feeling disgusted may make people lie and cheat more; cleanliness promotes ethical behaviour

Key questions:
- How come the Philae mission didn't use nuclear batteries like American missions do if it would have made it more successful?
- What is going on inside the heads of some internet feminists who make fun of someone's appearance after being called bullies?
- Could SpaceX's project for cheap high-quality satellite internet give people an alternative to existing internet providers like Comcast?
